page.title: 08HISTORIC HOUSES
page.content: {Elemore Hall,}once the home of many landowning families such as the Andersons, Halls, Congers and Baker- Baker, dates from 1637. It was burnt down in 1720 and rebuilt. Its origins are obscure, but early records show that the land was given by Bishop Pudsey to Finchale Priory in 1200 A.D. Today it is designated as a Durham County Council Special School and houses approximately 40 people. The driveways, ponds and gardens are still in evidence and provide a beautiful setting for walks. {The Manor House. }Once again its origins are obscure, but it is close to the site of the old Priory. For the last sixty years it has been the home of the Glen family. {The Vicarage}was built in Victorian times. It became a private residence in 1950.
